hypothesis_content.title: Failed Pre-Asian Open Breakdown in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp sell-off (-1.5% to -3.5%) in the 2-hour window BEFORE the Asian trading session open (22:00-00:00 UTC) that finds support and fails to make a new low in the first 2 hours AFTER the Asian open (00:00-02:00 UTC) will lead to a mean-reverting bounce, capturing the majority of the pre-open drop within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral markets, pre-Asian open sell-offs are often low-liquidity 'hunting' moves. A failure to continue lower as Asian liquidity enters suggests a lack of genuine selling pressure, triggering short covering and opportunistic buying. The Asian session often provides a natural liquidity pool for reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC drops -1.5% to -3.5% between 22:00 & 00:00 UTC (pre-Asian open)
The low of the 00:00-02:00 UTC period (post-Asian open) is HIGHER than the low of the 22:00-00:00 UTC period (failed breakdown)
Entry on a 15-minute candle close above the VWAP of the 00:00-02:00 UTC range

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 75% of the pre-open drop (22:00-00:00 UTC decline)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new low below the 22:00-00:00 UTC period low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median capture of the pre-open drop is < 50% across signals, or win rate < 60%. The hypothesis fails if Asian session consistently adds to selling momentum instead of providing support.
